definition: to suit one's taste/suitable/congenial/by mutual agreement
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]

sentences.english: The European Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) originated from the acceptability of sovereignties in the European Community(EC).
sentences.chinese: 歐洲經貨聯盟源起於歐共體各主權國家的合意。

sentences.english: These have one mind, and shall give their power and strength unto the beast.
sentences.chinese: 他們同心合意，將自己的能力權柄給那獸。

sentences.english: Because of your partnership in the gospel from the first day until now.
sentences.chinese: 因爲頭一天直到如今，你們是同心合意的興旺福音。

sentences.english: ThisMOU shall be amended by mutual agreement in writing and dulyexecuted by the Parties.
sentences.chinese: 備忘錄應由各方合意以書面形式作出修改並依約履行。

sentences.english: That they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.
sentences.chinese: 就都聚集，同心合意地要與約書亞和以色列人爭戰。

sentences.english: they came together to make war against Joshua and Israel.
sentences.chinese: 就都聚集，同心合意地要與約書亞和以色列人爭戰。

sentences.english: In this article we compare English and Chinese from the point of hypotaxis and parataxis .
sentences.chinese: 本文從形合意合角度對英漢兩種語言進行了對比。

sentences.english: She has the required vulnerability, coyness and delicacy that befit her character Lucky.
sentences.chinese: 她所需要的脆弱性，羞怯與細緻的合意她的性格幸運。

sentences.english: What validates a marriage is the consent of the parties, not their cohabitation.
sentences.chinese: 合法的婚姻以雙方合意爲要件，而不因同居事實成立。

sentences.english: Jesus is looking for companions of compassion.
sentences.chinese: 主耶穌盼望的是同心合意的夥伴關係。

definition: to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
to take one's fancy/to be to one's liking
to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
